text: Chapter one The preachers daughter.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka finished performing her wudu in preparation for her afternoon prayers.
Name: Book 21

text: As she closed the bathroom door behind her the sound of her mother preparing the evening meal echoed around the otherwise quiet house.
Name: Book 21

text: The smell of spices and flavourings permeated the hall and floated up the stairs.
Name: Book 21

text: On her way down to her room she stopped at the kitchen door.
Name: Book 21

text: Do you need any help, hooyo.
Name: Book 21

text: No, no, you get on with your studies, habibti.
Name: Book 21

text: Your attention to your work is far more important.
Name: Book 21

text: Her parents emphasis on academic success equalled their views on observing religion.
Name: Book 21

text: Everything else was secondary.
Name: Book 21

text: Their attitude made the Victorians look liberal.
Name: Book 21

text: Her Yemeni father, an imam at the local mosque, insisted everyone in the house follow austere Muslim teachings.
Name: Book 21

text: The girls in the house all wore the hijab with abaya or other forms of loose fitting modest clothing.
Name: Book 21

text: Her sandals squeaked on the polished hall floor as she walked towards her room.
Name: Book 21

text: She couldnt help but be pleased with herself for achieving the room swap with her sister.
Name: Book 21

text: Safi had put no argument forward, thinking she had the best of the deal, and no one had questioned Zulekas logic for wanting the much smaller room downstairs.
Name: Book 21

text: They all agreed it gave her more privacy and provided a quiet place for her to study.
Name: Book 21

text: They hadnt suspected her real reason, her need to come and go without detection.
Name: Book 21

text: The flowing abaya she took down from the hook behind the door draped her body in modesty.
Name: Book 21

text: Guilt nudged away her self-satisfaction as she continued her ritual and laid out her prayer mat, a gift her father had brought for her from his pilgrimage to Mecca.
Name: Book 21

text: Asking for forgiveness for her ways clothed her in hypocrisy as she knew she could not give up how she lived her life.
Name: Book 21

text: As it always happened, her mind strayed when she started to recite the suras.
Name: Book 21

text: Shed discussed this once with her father and he had made her feel better by saying:  Thats the shaytaan, trying to steal the Baraka - the blessings of your prayers.
Name: Book 21

text: She made a determined effort to concentrate on God.
Name: Book 21

text: She had her midterm exams soon and needed his help.
Name: Book 21

text: Under her breath she recited the verse from the Al Fatiha, the opening sura of the Quran:.
Name: Book 21

text: In the name of God, the infinitely Compassionate and Merciful.
Name: Book 21

text: Praise be to God, Lord of all the worlds.
Name: Book 21

text: The Compassionate, the Merciful Ruler on the Day of Reckoning You alone do we worship, and You alone do we ask for help Guide us on the straight path, The path of those who have received your grace Not the path of those who have brought down wrath Nor of those who wander astray.
Name: Book 21

text: Once shed finished and with her conscience appeased, she folded the mat, placed her abaya back behind the door, and turned her attention to her studies.
Name: Book 21

text: The pile of books stacked on top of one another looked daunting, but she resigned herself to the task ahead.
Name: Book 21

text: In her last year studying medicine at Kings college, the pressure sometimes loaded against Zuleka.
Name: Book 21

text: Though it helped that from the beginning, much to her surprise, the workings of the internal organs had fascinated her.
Name: Book 21

text: Not the sexiest of subjects, she agreed, but better than law or accounting, the two areas her sisters studied.
Name: Book 21

text: Besides, she looked forward to having the title, Dr before her name.
Name: Book 21

text: Now that would be sexy.
Name: Book 21

text: A sound behind her made her look towards her open door.
Name: Book 21

text: Her mother stood there.
Name: Book 21

text: Mashallah, she muttered, I am proud to have you for my daughter.
Name: Book 21

text: Her smile and the gracious way she seemed to glide away brought a lump to Zulekas throat and the conflict inside her brought feelings of desolation.
Name: Book 21

text: Why couldnt she be more like her sisters.
Name: Book 21

text: Why did her sheltered and austere upbringing have the opposite effect on her than it had meant to.
Name: Book 21

text: Instead of wanting to practice obedience and piety she had a hunger for experiences and sought ways to express her individuality.
Name: Book 21

text: At times she felt she burned like a bright, beautiful star that refused to blend into the night sky.
Name: Book 21

text: She thirsted for adrenaline and frivolous fun.
Name: Book 21

text: Her arms made a comforting cushion as she rested her head on them.
Name: Book 21

text: No answers came to her, but thinking about what Hani had said to her sometime ago relaxed her.
Name: Book 21

text: She could have it all.
Name: Book 21

text: She could burn the candle at both ends.
Name: Book 21

text: No one need ever find out.
Name: Book 21

text: Tomorrow shed give herself a day off and shed be the Zuleka she wanted to be.
Name: Book 21

text: Oblivious to the line of people behind her in Starbucks, and with yesterdays worries banished from her mind, Zuleka leaned forward over the counter and shouted at the nervous barista, No.
Name: Book 21

text: I ordered a skinny mocha.
Name: Book 21

text: Do I look like the type to have cream in my coffee.
Name: Book 21

text: Just bear with me for a second, Ms.
Name: Book 21

text: Ill make you another one.
Name: Book 21

text: Her annoyance was replaced by amusement as she waited and watched him in his flustered state struggling to maintain a veneer of coolness.
Name: Book 21

text: She dodged the dirty looks and ignored the skinny bitch comment that came her way as she stood aside to allow the others in the queue to place their orders.
Name: Book 21

text: With her mocha in one hand and her huge floppy bag in the other she turned in the direction of Selfridges.
Name: Book 21

text: Her long hair bounced as she walked, its jet-black colour complimenting the light tone of her skin and the striking beauty of her face.
Name: Book 21

text: Her movements emulated the models on the cat-walk as she swung her body giving her curves just the right amount of exposure.
Name: Book 21

text: Meaning only to window shop, Zuleka ditched her empty cup into a nearby bin and walked into Selfridges; for her, it was a paradise of beautiful smells, glittering glass counters, and expensive goods  she belonged.
Name: Book 21

text: Bright bold colours and expensive designer brands were her downfall, not to mention the accessories she needed to compliment them.
Name: Book 21

text: Stashed in Hamdis flat, Zuleka had an impressive number of shoes, bags, wallets, and watches and a wardrobe of forbidden, but gorgeous outfits.
Name: Book 21

text: The only downfall to this obsession came through her letter box every month - her bank statement.
Name: Book 21

text: Always shocked by the amount she spent but ever ready to allow her shopping-friendly conscience to console her, the offending reminder of her addiction resembled wedding confetti when it floated to the bottom of her bin.
Name: Book 21

text: After all, most of the items had been on sale or promotion, so she had saved money, hadnt she.
Name: Book 21

text: Do you need any assistance, miss.
Name: Book 21

text: I am just browsing.
Name: Book 21

text: Her answer was to convince herself as she tried to ignore the small voice inside her prompting her to buy as she moved from rail to rail.
Name: Book 21

text: She stopped in front of one of the many glistening mirrors, straightened her posture, and checked over her appearance.
Name: Book 21

text: Skinny jeans, a bright red cardigan with the sleeves pulled up to her elbows showing off a set of wooden bangles inlaid with intricate gold patterns that was complimented by the Lois Vuitton pumps.
Name: Book 21

text: A far cry from the demure, black abaya shed left home in, which now lay strewn across Hamdis bed ready for her to change back into.
Name: Book 21

text: Like Cinderella after the ball.
Name: Book 21

text: Damn, that thought had dampened her spirits.
Name: Book 21

text: A few items had caught her eye.
Name: Book 21

text: She re-traced her steps and grabbed them from the rail.
Name: Book 21

text: Not stopping to try them on she bundled them together and headed for the counter.
Name: Book 21

text: Her mobile rang as she stuffed her credit card back into her purse.
Name: Book 21

text: Hi, are you coming over to AAs.
Name: Book 21

text: The others are meeting there in about an hour.
Name: Book 21

text: The guilt of her purchases forgotten, her fun elements shook up again, she told Hani shed be there and left the shop, both arms now leaden with bags.
Name: Book 21

text: The hot day had left behind a balmy evening and even now, just before 7 pm, the night promised to stay warm and humid.
Name: Book 21

text: Edgware Rd  AKA, the Arab Capital of London vibrated with life.
Name: Book 21

text: She walked in front of Abu Amin, the Lebanese restaurant, or AA - short for - Addicts Anonymous, as she and the others called it and glanced at those already seating at the pavement tables.
Name: Book 21

text: Smoke curled around them, but didnt hide their leers in her direction.
Name: Book 21

text: All men, Arabs in their forties but looking older, the freedom they enjoyed flashed feelings of resentment through her.
Name: Book 21

text: Heading through the restaurant towards the discreet door at the back, which those not in the know might wrongly assume led to the staff room, she went through and descended the stairs to a different world.
Name: Book 21

text: The sound of high-pitched music vibrated through the haze of aromatic shisha, and the air throbbed with the energy of youth.
Name: Book 21

text: This is where the party is at.
Name: Book 21

text: Besides the young, the place attracted colourful characters: from the Turkish man who walked in and out trying to sell roses to students who cared for none, to the Chinese lady, who approached each table and opened her trench coat as if about to flash, but instead revealed counterfeit DVDs hung in their dozens around her body.
Name: Book 21

text: And, of course, there were the waiters, some of whom they had a love-hate relationship with.
Name: Book 21

text: Tonight, thank Allah, Mahad, who only spoke enough English to let them know he wasnt too enthusiastic on them, wasnt on duty.
Name: Book 21

text: A mean, vertically-challenged man, he wore tee-shirts that looked like they had shrunk in the washing cycle or belonged on the shelves of Baby Gap.
Name: Book 21

text: He had a major Napoleon complex.
Name: Book 21

text: Mohamed, their favourite push-over waiter came over to her.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka pampered to his obvious attraction to her knowing this would secure a generous discount, an important ingredient for her and her friends, and permission to plug in her iPod to the back of the stereo so they could listen to some R&B rather than the same Arabic music that was always on play.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani called over to her.
Name: Book 21

text: She and Hamdi sat in their usual corner with Ayan.
Name: Book 21

text: She hadnt seen Ayan for a while.
Name: Book 21

Name: Book 21

Name: Book 21

text: Chapter Two Roping in Hamdi.
Name: Book 21

text: Hamdi set her mouth in a pout.
Name: Book 21

text: Lorenzo didnt stand a chance.
Name: Book 21

text: Tonight she would know what he had to give.
Name: Book 21

text: Impatience had her sitting forward.
Name: Book 21

text: She clung on to the handle next to the door of the cab to steady her.
Name: Book 21

text: The teasing of Hani and Zuleka and the way Ayan had become quite cross had affected her.
Name: Book 21

text: She knew she pushed the boundaries further than they dare, but not further than they would like to.
Name: Book 21

text: They were jealous of her carefree life, and the way she could come and go as she pleased with very little care for the societal rules that imprisoned them, but they didnt envy how she came to have that freedom.
Name: Book 21

text: Trying to concentrate on the people busying along the streets and the shop windows displaying everything the world had to offer, didnt help.
Name: Book 21

text: Her friends criticism had nudged the place inside her where she kept the things she didnt like to visit.
Name: Book 21

text: In doing so they had evoked memories of another life that had shaped and haunted her, and highlighted a comparison she didnt want to make, but knew to be true: her behaviour imitated the very person she hated the most- her mother.
Name: Book 21

text: Born in Somalia, into a society where the sheer numbers of your clan guaranteed your security, others had regarded theirs as weak.
Name: Book 21

text: They had joked about her father.
Name: Book 21

text: In the habit of marrying and divorcing multiple women, they said hed wagered a one man mission to increase the size of their clan.
Name: Book 21

text: When he divorced her mother she left behind everything of her old life, including Hamdi.
Name: Book 21

text: The feeling of utter desolation this had given her throbbed once more through her breast.
Name: Book 21

text: She closed her eyes.
Name: Book 21

text: Tried to dispel the unloved and unwanted child from within her, but the open sore of bitterness her parents had gouged into her bled once more.
Name: Book 21

text: Like a slide show clicking in her mind she saw pictures of herself.
Name: Book 21

text: Lonely and unwanted, passed around from pillar to post, whilst her father took care of his own needs and her mother scandalised their community as she threw herself into the liberal society of 1980s Mogadishu.
Name: Book 21

text: In these moments of revisiting her past the condemnation of the women of the village resounded in her ears as theyd piled her mothers sins upon her little shoulders.
Name: Book 21

text: You see how she plays with the boys, while the other girls are helping out in the kitchen.
Name: Book 21

text: Mark my words, shes going to end up like her mother, thats all shell be good for.
Name: Book 21

text: Was it fair that at ten years of age shed had to endure such talk and prophecies about her future.
Name: Book 21

text: Oh, what did it all matter, now.
Name: Book 21

text: Shed never be able to get even with her father, hed lost his life in the civil war and she had no notion of where her mother was, or even if she still lived, though her last memory of her sat heavy in her heart.
Name: Book 21

text: Dumped back with her mother after her fathers death, together they had walked mile after mile with hundreds of other displaced people.
Name: Book 21

text: She could still taste the dust and feel the ache in her little legs and the burning sores on her feet.
Name: Book 21

text: And remember the joy of at last reaching a refugee camp Nimo, a clanswoman, had tramped with them.
Name: Book 21

text: If she hadnt done so, Hamdi knew she would not have made it out alive as her joy had soon turned to desolation.
Name: Book 21

text: She recoiled against the memory.
Name: Book 21

text: Saw once more the slime running down the hill between the makeshift huts.
Name: Book 21

text: Felt it curl its way around her feet, bringing a stink which had made her retch.
Name: Book 21

text: She swallowed as her throat dried at the memory of the hot ache in her throat for the want of a drink and how, just as shed thought to scoop up some of the filth and suck the liquid from it, Nimo had returned from the water allocation bay, lifted her up and dripped soothing drops of water on to her tongue.
Name: Book 21

text: Still going through the motions of time, Hamdi put her head back as if lifting her face to Nimo and felt once again the cool cloth shed used to wipe away the mud from her face and the caked matter from her eyes.
Name: Book 21

text: Her pupils stung with held back tears; that was the moment she first felt loved.
Name: Book 21

text: Shed clung on to the thread of hope Nimo had offered and had never left her side.
Name: Book 21

text: Together theyd fetched their daily supplies of water and their rations of food and had made fires and cooked what meals they could and kept their area clean.
Name: Book 21

text: Her mother hadnt hung around much.
Name: Book 21

text: Men would loiter in their vicinity and she would go with them, returning when she needed food.
Name: Book 21

text: Then one day the gates of the compound opened and Nimo walked through with her in tow, showed some papers to the guards, and was ushered out.
Name: Book 21

text: Looking back sure in the knowledge she would not return shed seen her mother talking to one of the men shed called uncle  and though shed kept her eyes on her until the truck she and Nimo had climbed onto went around a corner, her mother never once looked towards her.
Name: Book 21

text: Never once put up her hand to wave goodbye.
Name: Book 21

text: Nimo had somehow passed her off as her daughter and brought her to England.
Name: Book 21

text: They had settled in Leicester, where Nimo still lives.
Name: Book 21

text: Hamdi shifted in her seat, she is my mother and always will be and her family are mine, too.
Name: Book 21

text: Thinking of them now she had an overwhelming urge to visit them soon.
Name: Book 21

text: Hey, hun, you alright.

text: Sorry to barge in so early, but I want to try these on to see what you think, and then, we can go for breakfast and you can dish the dosh on last night, okay.
Name: Book 21

text: She flashed the Selfridges bag.
Name: Book 21

text: Its scrunched up look told of its night stuffed out of sight in a small place.
Name: Book 21

text: New clothes, whats the occasion.
Name: Book 21

text: Nothing really, I just felt like treating myself.
Name: Book 21

text: The smell, freshness, and excitement only expensive gear can give off stopped any further worries of the shopaholic kind, as Hamdi picked up each garment.
Name: Book 21

text: Wow, lady, you made some good choices Wait before you judge, Im not sure on these hot pants.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka gathered them up and took off to the bathroom.
Name: Book 21

text: A familiar tone sang out from Hamdis mobile.
Name: Book 21

text: Good Morning, Miss Elusive, You x Lorenzo.
Name: Book 21

text: That man had sure got under her skin.
Name: Book 21

text: She texted back, Good Morning, Mr frustrating, you Her x went there, but then she deleted it, it wouldnt hurt him to think shes still mad at him.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka appeared in the shorts that left nothing to the imagination.
Name: Book 21

text: Hamdi let out a whistle, Wow, youre brave for buying those.
Name: Book 21

text: But you need the right pair of shoes if youre going pull it off  Zuleka scrambled around in the bottom of her wardrobe reappearing with four inch Jimmy Choos.
Name: Book 21

text: The effect when she put them on transformed her into a sex-bomb.
Name: Book 21

text: Though, theres isnt a need to impress anyone.
Name: Book 21

text: In case you havent noticed, I am going through a drought with guys.
Name: Book 21

text: Feisal stopped calling me ever since getting it on with that Kuwaiti chick.
Name: Book 21

text: Hamdi grimaced, but knew Zuleka missed the expensive gifts her rich Saudi ex showered her with, more than she did him.
Name: Book 21

text: So, just get yourself a new buddy for the lonely times, God knows there are plenty of men willing to take his place.
Name: Book 21

text: And those shorts are drought proof.
Name: Book 21

text: Wear them and watch them flock in, girl.
Name: Book 21

text: Youre mistaking my needs here.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka stripped off the hot pants and started her wriggling manoeuvre to don her trademark skinny jeans.
Name: Book 21

text: Feisal came with petrol dollars Girl, your gold digging ways never fail to amaze me.
Name: Book 21

text: But, if thats the case, then I suggest you wait for the Arab season.
Name: Book 21

text: Come on, Im starving.
Name: Book 21

text: Hamdi almost laughed, theyd sat on the tall stools in the brassiere munching breakfast rolls, and drinking mochas for at least ten minutes before Zuleka remembered the man related dilemma Hamdi was in.
Name: Book 21

text: By the way, how was your date.
Name: Book 21

text: Thanks for caring.
Name: Book 21

text: No, I mean, well, I know I have been going on about my love life of late, but Lorenzo has me in a place Ive never been before.
Name: Book 21

text: Despite all my efforts we only just moved out of first gear.
Name: Book 21

text: I had me a kiss that promised big things, but thats it.
Name: Book 21

text: Ive found me a hot Italian whos roped in his emotions so he can explore the real me.
Name: Book 21

text: Someone should tell him hes on to a loser there, girl.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka.
Name: Book 21

text: Be serious will you.
Name: Book 21

text: Im like a kitten purring on his lap and he wants none of it.
Name: Book 21

text: Taking it slow is something you need to learn and I think Lorenzo is good for you.
Name: Book 21

text: Different, but good.
Name: Book 21

text: Hes got under my skin, I can tell you and, not just because he presents a challenge.
Name: Book 21

text: Hes really sweet, just this morning he sent me a good morning text.
Name: Book 21

text: Honestly, who does that.
Name: Book 21

text: Decent guys, but you dont know many of them.
Name: Book 21

text: The turmoil started up again in Hamdi at Zulekas words.
Name: Book 21

text: Some part of her knew what she said made sense, but it did nothing to quell her frustration.
Name: Book 21

text: Shed send a nice text to Lorenzo, anyway.
Name: Book 21

text: Maybe shed even apologise.
Name: Book 21

text: But then, Zulekas next words riled her up once more and a rebellion set up inside her, You shock me, Hamdi.
Name: Book 21

text: I can tell youve got it bad.
Name: Book 21

text: You just dont seem to realise you are in a good place, and one I never thought to see you in.
Name: Book 21

text: I didnt think the day would ever come when someone succeeded in roping you in, girl.
Name: Book 21

text: Is that what was happening.
Name: Book 21

text: No one roped in Hamdi Ismail.
Name: Book 21

text: Chapter Three The quintessential foreigner.
Name: Book 21

text: The sound of her mother wailing as if there had been a death in the family put Hani in flight mode.
Name: Book 21

text: She made it to the front door and just as she had her hand on the yale lock her mother came out of the living room waving a utility bill like a victory flag and lassoing her with her voice, How can they do this.
Name: Book 21

text: Who is it that allows such robbery.
Name: Book 21

text: What Who is robbing you, Hooyo.
Name: Book 21

text: A burst of angry Somali told her that British Gas schemed and plotted to steal money from her mothers little purse to further line their fat pockets.
Name: Book 21

text: God, why had she pressed the snooze button instead of getting up when she should have done.
Name: Book 21

text: Shed have reached safety by now.
Name: Book 21

text: Hooyo, you really should learn to speak English better, and then you would understand these things.
Name: Book 21

text: Not learning the language only amounted to a third of the frustrations her mother brought down on Hani.
Name: Book 21

text: Her insistence on bargaining for everything in the manner of her native country also went in to the mixing pot along with her constant health problems.
Name: Book 21

text: Going into overdrive her mother demanded Hani ring the gas board and stop this utter outrage and, didnt she have educated children to do these tasks and to translate for her.
Name: Book 21

text: To her credit she did manage some of this in English.
Name: Book 21

text: Knowing it would be futile to resist, Hani picked up the phone.
Name: Book 21

text: Her mother stayed on her heals railing about her being firm and not to mumble.
Name: Book 21

text: Yes, I know Hooyo; dont you trust me to make a phone call.
Name: Book 21

text: Like a practiced deceiver she omitted one digit as she tapped in the numbers, rolled her eyes to signify her annoyance as she pretended they had placed her on hold for a whole minute, and then, proceeded to read out the details of the bill and have an argument with herself.
Name: Book 21

text: But, this is outrageous, its daylight robbery.
Name: Book 21

text: Did you say an estimated bill.
Name: Book 21

text: Are you bloody kidding.
Name: Book 21

text: What do you think we do here when you make your calculations, run a soup kitchen for the homeless of London.
Name: Book 21

text: Her mother cheered her on whilst plying her with questions to ask the non-existent customer service assistant.
Name: Book 21

text: After a moment or two of pretend anger and frustration, Hani calmed herself.
Name: Book 21

text: I agree, thats a good idea, although you should have someone come in to read the meter before all of this.
Name: Book 21

text: No, that will be all, Im sorry I got angry, thank you for your assistance.
Name: Book 21

text: Bloody Hell, she felt sorry for an invisible person now.
Name: Book 21

text: Turns out its just an estimated bill, hooyo, they will send someone out to check the meter before the next one you have nothing to worry about, anymore.
Name: Book 21

text: Talk about escaping the pan and jumping into the fire.
Name: Book 21

text: Now Ill have to pay the stupid bill.
Name: Book 21

text: But better that, than have her mother force her to make another call when the final demand arrived.
Name: Book 21

text: I have to go now, hooyo, or Ill be late.
Name: Book 21

text: When will you be back, I am not feeling well, and I need you to translate at the doctors for me I have a hair appointment, hooyo; you know Im going to Ayans cousins wedding tonight.
Name: Book 21

text: Not a pang of guilt entered her as she said this, her mother more than bordered on the hypochondriac level and Hani knew if she didnt get to the salon soon there would not be enough time for them to deal with her hair.
Name: Book 21

text: Not blessed with the average soft curls of Somali girls; it took hours to stop her looking like Macy Gray on crack.
Name: Book 21

text: Get Salim to take you, he should be back from work by then.
Name: Book 21

text: She escaped before her mother could reply.
Name: Book 21

text: Their mother ran her and her sister and brother around when it suited her and had done so since their father had died when they were only children.
Name: Book 21

text: Even though countless tests had not thrown up anything more serious than thyroid and blood pressure problems, which were well controlled, she used her supposed ill-health like a weapon to heap guilt on them to get what she wanted.
Name: Book 21

text: There had been several changes of GPs.
Name: Book 21

text: All branded as under qualified whenever they didnt find her elusive illnesses.
Name: Book 21

text: In the end shed tricked her way into the care of Dr.
Name: Book 21

text: Patel, an Indian GP.
Name: Book 21

text: Their aunt, her mothers sister, had raved about him, so in order to get onto his books, her mother, using the typical cheat the system Somali mentality, had registered using her sisters address.
Name: Book 21

text: Their first visit to Dr Patel spread light on why Somali women of a certain age favoured him.
Name: Book 21

text: The man did not possess the assertive qualities of the other doctors and they could dominate him, even her mother, using only her broken English had him cowering.
Name: Book 21

text: He caved in to her endless demands for blood tests and easily prescribed her with medications, which turned her room into a mini pharmacy.
Name: Book 21

text: However, the constant stream of visits to his surgery and the faking of phone calls to utility companies made for an easy trade off  hooyo, busy with these distractions hadnt a clue what she got up to or where she went to have fun.
Name: Book 21

text: If only it could be that simple with her brother, Salim.
Name: Book 21

text: Not wanting to dampen her spirits by thinking of him and his one-man crusade to keep her in line, she thought about her encounter with the invisible man on the phone and laughed to herself.
Name: Book 21

text: She must be mad.
Name: Book 21

text: But, she had to admit, ingenious at the same time.
Name: Book 21

text: Chapter Four The CNN ladies and weddings.
Name: Book 21

text: Hey, Hani, look at you.
Name: Book 21

text: Youll more than pass, Zuleka beckoned her to where she and Hamdi had saved her a place.
Name: Book 21

text: As shed spoken shed nodded over to where a group of women sat.
Name: Book 21

text: Old, overly critical and done up to the nines with heavy gold jewellery hanging from their necks and wrists, they represented Zulekas and hers worst nightmare.
Name: Book 21

text: Youll be the talk of the gossips.
Name: Book 21

text: Theyll have you lined up for some good marriage prospect in no time.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani laughed, but enjoyed the warm feeling the compliment had given her.
Name: Book 21

text: Choosing something that would satisfy the restrictions of covering herself in a modest way and yet give her some glamour had worked out well and she felt good in her long black dress which she had complimented with a delicate, shimmering red scarf to drape over her shoulders.
Name: Book 21

text: To finish the outfit off shed matched the scarfs colour to her killer heels.
Name: Book 21

text: I dont know who invented high heels, but you owe him a lot.
Name: Book 21

text: Those shoes make you a ten Thank you, both.
Name: Book 21

text: You look great too, gorgeous, in fact, but hey, what gives with you, Hamdi.
Name: Book 21

text: I thought you at least would kick against the expected and turn up in your usual freak.
Name: Book 21

text: I thought I would have a bit of respect for Ayan I know me too, but having said that, it always surprises me how relaxed I feel when dressed like this and beautiful, too, in a different kind of way Watch it girl, youll turn into Ayan.
Name: Book 21

text: Whos taking my name in vain.
Name: Book 21

text: Oh, hi, Ayan.
Name: Book 21

text: We were just having a laugh at seeing each other looking so demure, and saying how wed done it for you.
Name: Book 21

text: Me and the gossips, you mean, Hani.
Name: Book 21

text: But, you look great all of you.
Name: Book 21

text: I wish I could hang around with you, but you know how it is Ayan stayed a few minutes chatting with them, but soon, like a nervous kitten, she said, I have to go.
Name: Book 21

text: You guys have fun, okay.
Name: Book 21

text: Is she hiding again.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani asked as she watched Ayan tuck herself away in a far corner.
Name: Book 21

text: I think so, poor girl.
Name: Book 21

text: Shes dodged several aunts already and those she hasnt have only one question for her, when will it be your turn, Ayan, surely you must be next.
Name: Book 21

text: The loudspeakers booming out Somali music drowned out their laughter at Zulekas mimicking of the aunts.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani looked around her at the sea of colourful dresses on the dance floor.
Name: Book 21

text: She scanned the room for anyone she knew, fighting the claustrophobic feeling which always attacked her at weddings.
Name: Book 21

text: She hated them, but couldnt escape them.
Name: Book 21

text: They were the single most important event in Somali peoples social calendar.
Name: Book 21

text: People took mortal offence if someone did not attend their family wedding.
Name: Book 21

text: Friendships broke up forever over a missed invite.
Name: Book 21

text: Unless one had a very good reason not to attend, the wise and polite thing to do was to at least make an appearance.
Name: Book 21

text: Summer heralded the season for weddings.
Name: Book 21

text: This month alone she had attended three and each had been a more lavish affair than the last one, even though few could afford it.
Name: Book 21

text: Most landed themselves in debt for years, and not only them; invited female guests spent a pretty dime on their diraacs, the long silky dresses traditionally worn by Somali women.
Name: Book 21

text: And, since nobody wanted to wear their outfit at subsequent weddings, it sometimes became a nightmare, leading Somali men to joke:  Unless your pockets are deep, beware of marrying a woman who likes to attend weddings Watch out theres a camera about.
Name: Book 21

text: This exclamation from Hamdi brought her out of her thoughts.
Name: Book 21

text: She did the same as the others and grabbed her bag and dived for the loo.
Name: Book 21

text: Phew, I think they missed us This time, but we need a film guard on duty if we dont want to end up being chosen from the DVD as future brides.
Name: Book 21

text: Youre right, Hamdi, and I think we should take it in turns.
Name: Book 21

text: You go first while the camera man is still at his most active.
Name: Book 21

text: Youll be scanning the room looking for talent anyway, so you might as well keep a watch while you do.
Name: Book 21

text: I like your cheek, lady.
Name: Book 21

text: Talent comes to me, Ill have you know.
Name: Book 21

text: Either way, no-one is trusted with looking out for this lady, Zuleka said.
Name: Book 21

text: Im going to keep these eyes peeled.
Name: Book 21

text: Theres no way Im ending up as a mail-order bride.
Name: Book 21

text: Their laughter echoed around the tiled room and doubling them over, but Hani knew a truth in what Zuleka had said.

frame.Frame: Cause change of position on a scale

Name: Book 21

text: Somalis were the Jews of Africa, their network spread worldwide.
Name: Book 21

text: Someone in any part of the world could quite easily spot them as a potential as the DVD did its rounds for the purpose of mothers who looked to settle their sons.
Name: Book 21

text: As their laughter died, make up repair went into top gear before they stepped back into the main hall.
Name: Book 21

text: Linking arms with Hamdi, Hani said, what about the spies and the gossipers, whos going to watch out for them.
Name: Book 21

text: Well all have to be on our guard.
Name: Book 21

text: Oh, I dont know, these weddings.
Name: Book 21

text: Theyre bloody hard work.
Name: Book 21

text: Youre right, its one round of ducking and diving from the cameraman, steering clear of the ladies who might notice something you dont want them to notice, while at the same time trying to have a good time and maintain the interest or flirt with a guy who may have caught your attention.
Name: Book 21

text: Why do we give a shit.
Name: Book 21

text: Do we have a choice.
Name: Book 21

text: I just hope that talent Ayan promised turns up soon.
Name: Book 21

text: Oh, come on girls, Zuleka hooked into Hamdis other arm.
Name: Book 21

text: Lets have some fun and to hell with the lot of them.
Name: Book 21

text: *** Around 10pm the bride and groom arrived fashionably late, with the groomsmen and the bridesmaids walking behind them.
Name: Book 21

text: The noise of the clapping drowned out the music, but they didnt need it anyway as some began to chant in a sing-song way.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani caught Hamdis eye and had to resist the urge to giggle at the mischief she saw in her eyes.
Name: Book 21

text: Ayan hadnt told a lie when shed said the grooms friends were hot and Hamdi could soon forget her passion for Lorenzo, it seemed.
Name: Book 21

text: The crowd parted down the middle for the bride to pass by to take her place on stage.
Name: Book 21

text: Her visible nerves didnt account for her over-pale look.
Name: Book 21

text: The make-up shed chosen didnt match her natural skin tone.
Name: Book 21

text: Being two or three shades lighter it spoilt the over-all look of her stunning, ivory-white dress.
Name: Book 21

text: Damn, Hamdi said under her breath, whats with the geisha look.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka strained her neck above the crowd to get a better look, It looks like she tripped and landed in a pot of white chalk.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani thought the same, but felt a need to flag up the brides good points, Well, the dress is a nice fit.
Name: Book 21

text: Yes, but the Pat Butcher eye shadow.
Name: Book 21

text: Boy, has her make-up girl been watching too much of Eastenders or what.
Name: Book 21

text: I know.
Name: Book 21

text: The make-up is hobo the clown wrong, but Oh, thats just you, Hani.
Name: Book 21

text: You like to see the best in folk.
Name: Book 21

text: But despite the gaffs, I bet every girl in this room is wishing it was them walking up to those beautiful thrones.
Name: Book 21

text: Zulekas face took on a dreamlike quality, Look at her; shes like a little queen smiling at all her subjects.
Name: Book 21

text: I would love to have all these people clapping and singing words of praises and a thousand blessings on me, it would be so divine.
Name: Book 21

text: Only for the attention, not what goes with it and you know it, Z.
Name: Book 21

text: Youre nowhere near ready to settle down.
Name: Book 21

text: Anyway, youre not hearing the claws scratching, girl.
Name: Book 21

text: The rooms full of cats.
Name: Book 21

text: The clapping didnt drown out the remarks of those close to them: Mash Allah, he is really good looking.
Name: Book 21

text: I never would have thought that someone like her was capable of bagging such a man.
Name: Book 21

text: Where do you think they met.
Name: Book 21

text: I am sure Ive seen him in Blue Bar.
Name: Book 21

text: I dont know, but his face is familiar to me.
Name: Book 21

text: Anyways, check out that girl over there, I swear she wore that same dress to the last wedding.
Name: Book 21

text: And so it went on topped only by the gold dripping ladies:  Nayaa.
Name: Book 21

text: That white dress is a little bit revealing isnt it.
Name: Book 21

text: Yes, I wonder where her mother was when she chose to wear such a thing.
Name: Book 21

text: Subhunallah, what is the world coming to.
Name: Book 21

text: Puuh.
Name: Book 21

text: And the father is a hajj, imagine that.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani noticed these remarks changed in a drastic way as the mother of the bride approached the ladies looking for their approval.
Name: Book 21

text: Congratulation.
Name: Book 21

text: they chanted in unison.
Name: Book 21

text: Mashallah, a beautiful wedding.
Name: Book 21

text: She looks the picture of health.
Name: Book 21

text: May her first born be a son and may Allah protect her from the shaytaan himself.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani let out a sigh of frustration.
Name: Book 21

text: Allah, preserve me from growing old like them, she prayed.
Name: Book 21

text: She looked around her knowing the comments she heard were only snippets of what went around the room as the various small groups that had formed gave testimony to a similar kind of cattiness taking place out of ear shot.
Name: Book 21

text: The suffocating feeling re-visited herbeing under microscopic lenses of the ever present, persistence cameraman made her want to escape for some air.
Name: Book 21

text: Stronger than that, an overwhelming urge to light up a cigarette and enjoy its calming effect took her.
Name: Book 21

text: Come along.
Name: Book 21

text: exclaimed the brides proud mother as she marched extended family members, cousins, aunties and uncles up to the stage to have their pictures taken with the couple.
Name: Book 21

text: Amongst them Hani saw Ayan hadnt escaped despite her attempts to lay low.
Name: Book 21

text: Although, Hani knew it would be impossible to convince her, she couldnt help thinking Ayan looked very beautiful.
Name: Book 21

text: Her light skin glowed with the hint of bronzer powder, and although her black dress did not cling to her figure it did not hide the outline of her curvy, womanly body.
Name: Book 21

text: As people shuffled around to accommodate everyone on the stage, the shawl around Ayans neck slipped a little, exposing just a tiny hint of her full cleavage.
Name: Book 21

text: She pulled it back into place but the sight prompted another round of comments from the ladies:  Halimo, who is the girl in the black up there on the stage.
Name: Book 21

text: Mashallah, she has a good look about her.
Name: Book 21

text: Thats Ayan Elmi; the bride is her first cousin from her mothers side.
Name: Book 21

text: A very good girl, you only have to look at how she has conducted herself all night to see she is marriageable, very marriageable, Id say.
Name: Book 21

text: I can introduce you to the mother if you are of that mind.
Name: Book 21

text: I am.
Name: Book 21

text: You know my nephew, Hassan.
Name: Book 21

text: He is getting on in years, but Alhamdulillah, though he is doing very well, his career is leaving him with no time to look for a decent girl.
Name: Book 21

text: The family tires of waiting; perhaps I will mention Ayan to the boys mother.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani had a mental picture of the guy, an over educated, middle-aged man with a balding spot on his head.
Name: Book 21

text: Having no time to look for a girl meant he had zero game and probably couldnt string two interesting words together, poor Ayan.
Name: Book 21

text: As everything settled down and the cameras clicked and flashed Hamdi leaned towards Hani, Ayan was so not wrong with the fresh talent thing.
Name: Book 21

text: Ive seen some blessed brothers up in this joint and Im ready to do my thing.
Name: Book 21

text: Good luck with that, but I need a break, Im going outside to smoke.
Name: Book 21

text: Not a smoker as such, Hani always carried some with her ready for when the occasion arose and she might need one.
Name: Book 21

text: That time had come.
Name: Book 21

text: The loud music combined with the hustle and bustle made her feel dizzy and the busy-bodies crushed her free spirit.
Name: Book 21

text: Outside she looked for a secluded enough space to spark up in peace, away from the prying eyes of those who frowned upon smoking as un-ladylike behaviour.
Name: Book 21

text: It hadnt been easy as a lot of young people, albeit more young men in sharp suits than women, had flocked out to do the same, but eventually shed found a somewhere near to the car park.
Name: Book 21

text: She must let Hamdi know where the talent congregated.
Name: Book 21

text: That boy-crazy girl changed men as often as she changed shoes.
Name: Book 21

text: This thought brought a smile to her face.
Name: Book 21

text: Hey, how you doing.
Name: Book 21

text: Jeez, cant a girl get a little break.
Name: Book 21

text: Recovering from her fright she fumbled with her unlit cigarette and debated whether she should try and conceal it.
Name: Book 21

text: The dilemma paled as she looked round and into the sharp green eyes of the handsome, immaculately attired groomsman.
Name: Book 21

text: Tall, with light brown skin and hair twisted into little dreads that came down to his ears, his friendly smile exposed cute dimples and a flawless set of teeth.
Name: Book 21

text: He wasnt Somali, but he was gorgeous.
Name: Book 21

text: His hand felt strong as it clasped hers, Hani, nice to meet you, Izzy So what are you doing at this wedding.
Name: Book 21

text: I couldnt help but notice how tortured you looked My friend, Ayan, is related to the bride.
Name: Book 21

text: She hadnt realised shed been so transparent.
Name: Book 21

text: Theyre not my thing Really.
Name: Book 21

text: This is my first time attending a Somali wedding and I am enjoying it so far.
Name: Book 21

text: Are you a friend of the groom.
Name: Book 21

text: Yeah, Zak is my mate so when he asked me to be his best man, there was only one answer.
Name: Book 21

text: Speaking of which, I gotta get back to my duties, but afterwards a couple of us are heading to Penthouse in Leicester square, maybe you and your girls can join us.
Name: Book 21

text: Maybe.
Name: Book 21

text: Great, see you later, then.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani watched him walk away.
Name: Book 21

text: He had a confident swagger about him.
Name: Book 21

text: Okay, so maybe weddings werent all bad.
Name: Book 21

text: Not when there was a chance of bagging yourself a hot man.
Name: Book 21

text: Finishing her cigarette she walked back inside.
Name: Book 21

text: Thank goodness it looked as though the reception had reached a point near to the end as the happy couple prepared to leave.
Name: Book 21

text: She headed for the ladies room.
Name: Book 21

text: Something compelled her to reapply her lipstick and spray her clothes with perfume before adjusting her dress.
Name: Book 21

text: Girl you think youre in with a chance or something.
Name: Book 21

text: She laughed at herself as she made her way back to the main hall.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka, Ayan, and Hamdi stood with Izzy and the other two groomsmen.
Name: Book 21

text: As she came up to them she saw Ayan introducing everyone to one another.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka spotted her and turning her back to the group grabbed her before she reached them, Oh, my God, he is soo hot.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani laughed, Which one.
Name: Book 21

text: The tall one, with the dimples, his names Izzy, let me introduce you, she grabbed Hanis hand, giving her no chance to say anything and pulled her further into the group, Izzy, this is our other friend, Hani, she said, flashing him a brilliant smile before turning to the others and, Hani, this is Tariq and Mohammed.
Name: Book 21

text: Actually Hani and I met earlier Oh, okay.
Name: Book 21

text: Thats great.
Name: Book 21

text: Well, now that we are all introduced we should probably make our way.
Name: Book 21

text: Though Zuleka smiled an acknowledgment of Izzys suggestion her nervous glance around the room as she did so told of her fear.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani knew it centred on the gossipers or CNN ladies  AKA reporters, as they referred to them.
Name: Book 21

text: Chapter Seven The blowing of Zulekas cover.

text: Like a veteran CIA agent Zuleka had perfected her game and lulled herself into thinking shed get away with anything.

text: Guilt visited her less and less when she stood demure and saint-like while her mother extolled her virtues to anyone who would listen as she told of her pride in her daughters achievement of never scoring less than straight As in any exam she took, how she studied and prayed, how she helped around the house and kept to the strict Islamic teachings, and how she could speak Arabic, even though shed been born in England.

text: This second language also adhered her father to her more than ever as he considered Arabic the most refined language in the entire civilized world.

text: Going over all this in her mind she could paper over the deep crevices of discord inside her and plan the next outing without a second thought to anything in her life changing.

text: Her mind gave her the game she and her sisters used to play on wet days when they were children.
Name: Book 21

text: Kneeling by the window they would each pick a bead of water and then compete as to which one would get to the bottom of the pane of glass first.
Name: Book 21

text: The sound of their little fists banging to encourage theirs to go faster and their squeals of delight when it did filled her head and triggered her sadness.
Name: Book 21

text: She mentally shook herself and checked her watch.
Name: Book 21

text: The bloody bus was late again.
Name: Book 21

text: A steady stream of buses pulled in, but none displayed the number 52 the one that ran from Notting Hill to Knightsbridge where she worked.
Name: Book 21

text: If it didnt arrive within the next five minutes shed be late for work, again.
Name: Book 21

text: She groaned inwardly and rolled her eyes.
Name: Book 21

text: Marta, her uptight Ukrainian supervisor ran the shop like a communist factory manager and Zuleka was not her favourite person.
Name: Book 21

text: She had no idea what she had done to get on Martas wrong side and she didnt care.
Name: Book 21

text: As long as her cheque went into the bank at the end of the month, Marta can scowl at her all she liked.
Name: Book 21

text: She tapped her foot and contemplated whether to cross the road and jump on the tube or whether to hail a cab, but decided against it.
Name: Book 21

text: The bus didnt cost as much as either of those two options and she had to watch her pennies, her budget remained very tight and cash flow caused her a lot of problems despite putting almost full time hours in at Cartiers.
Name: Book 21

text: To try to ease things if any overtime or covers for others holidays came up, she signed up for it.
Name: Book 21

text: Marta should be grateful to her; she had stepped in save her ass on numerous occasions when staff shortage occurred.
Name: Book 21

text: As a result shed had to cut classes more than shed liked and her university grades had suffered.
Name: Book 21

text: Trying to pull in extra studying after work had left her exhausted and dark circles ringed her eyes, but she stuck it out and never complained.
Name: Book 21

text: She consoled herself with the thought that soon the term would be over.
Name: Book 21

text: Ill still have to work hard, but the pressure will ease, when the new term starts again, but maybe things will have changed by then, who knows.
Name: Book 21

text: She arrived at work ten minutes late and found the Iron Lady, her private nick name for Marta, waiting with her arms crossed.
Name: Book 21

text: No customers ever needed attention at this time of the morning so it wasnt as if she had let the side down.
Name: Book 21

text: The first hour of the day usually entailed checking around with a duster and re-filling the displays from the safe.
Name: Book 21

text: Work, needing very few hands and done before she arrived for her shift anyway.
Name: Book 21

text: What time do you call this, Zuleka.
Name: Book 21

text: When the small hand is at ten and the long hand is at two, we usually call it ten past, she thought with a flash of annoyance.
Name: Book 21

text: Always the last one to leave the shop, often volunteering to stay behind with those pesky customers who dawdled at closing time and doing all the cashing up, surely meant cutting some slack for the odd time when she arrived late.
Name: Book 21

text: I realize I am ten minutes late, sorry Marta.
Name: Book 21

text: Time keeping isnt your strength, is it, Zuleka.
Name: Book 21

text: I have spoken to you about it before.
Name: Book 21

text: Consider this your final warning.
Name: Book 21

text: If you are late again you are sacked.
Name: Book 21

text: Her tight smile did not reach her eyes.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka gritted her teeth.
Name: Book 21

text: What is up with that bitch.
Name: Book 21

text: she said to Sam, the other Sales Associate who stood behind the glistening counter.
Name: Book 21

text: Ever since I started here she has been on my case.
Name: Book 21

text: Dont pay her any attention, she probably just feels threatened.
Name: Book 21

text: Youre pretty good at your job and you havent been here long, so.
Name: Book 21

text: she shrugged her shoulder as if that said it all before adding, not to mention how good you look in the uniform.
Name: Book 21

text: We are all good at the job.
Name: Book 21

text: Its not exactly rocket science, Zuleka did a twirl in front of the mirror.
Name: Book 21

text: The formal black trousers and fitted black jacket, worn with kitten heels did do her justice, and thanks for the compliment, its a pretty cool uniform, actually.
Name: Book 21

text: Probably the best bit about the job.
Name: Book 21

text: Youre welcome.
Name: Book 21

text: Anyway, on top of that you have outsold all of us, including Marta, since you joined.
Name: Book 21

text: Shes angling for the managerial spot and you are making her nervous.
Name: Book 21

text: Ugh.
Name: Book 21

text: I have no interest in managerial or supervising positions.
Name: Book 21

text: I am doing this to support me through uni; the bitch can relax.
Name: Book 21

text: I am going to be a doctor for Christ sake; Ive no ambitions what-so-ever to carve a career in retail.
Name: Book 21

text: She joined Sam behind the counter and took out some paper work regarding an order she had requested for one of her customers.
Name: Book 21

text: She smiled at herself for using the her in her head.
Name: Book 21

text: Now that Sam had mentioned it, she could see why Marta might have felt threatened.
Name: Book 21

text: Sam, if that is what is making Marta act like such a cow to me then the first opportunity you get, can you please put her straight.
Name: Book 21

text: I am not here to steal her bread.
Name: Book 21

text: I will.
Name: Book 21

text: Oh-oh, here comes the first customer.
Name: Book 21

text: Sam as first sales approached the lady browsing around the cabinet containing mens watches.
Name: Book 21

text: Left on her own, Zuleka searched the database for the ordered product.
Name: Book 21

text: As she did so her mind mulled over how things must look.
Name: Book 21

text: She had turned out to be a surprisingly good Sales Associate.
Name: Book 21

text: She knew all about luxury products and could give customers candid advice on purchases.
Name: Book 21

text: Especially the men looking to buy gifts for their girlfriends and wives, more than once a grateful male customer had stopped by to tell her that the gift had been a hit.
Name: Book 21

text: Many even asked for her personally when they wanted to purchase something again.
Name: Book 21

text: She didnt think anybody noticed or minded, but apparently Marta had.
Name: Book 21

text: It made her smile to think of her feeling threatened, but as much as she enjoyed working here, she could never escape the fact that she belonged in front of the counter: not behind it.
Name: Book 21

text: She didnt want to sell expensive jewellery, she wanted to wear it.
Name: Book 21

text: One of her biggest bug-bears at the moment centred round the staff discount.
Name: Book 21

text: Thirty percent off and she never had any money left over to take advantage of it.
Name: Book 21

text: How she envied the Eastern European ice maidens and the Arab princess who shopped at Harrods.
Name: Book 21

text: They looked so beautiful; long flowing tresses, (no doubt layered with extensions) manicured nails that never did a days work and immaculate clothes that were always up to date with the latest trends.
Name: Book 21

text: As if on cue, a trio of young Arab women dressed in long black abayas entered Harrods leaving the scent of heavy designer perfumes trailing in their wake.
Name: Book 21

text: All hail, the Arab season is here.
Name: Book 21

text: whispered Sam, rubbing her hands in glee.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka didnt have to ask the meaning of that.
Name: Book 21

text: Shed enjoyed a relationship with a petrol-rich student in the past, which had taken place in the Arab season, but she looked quizzical anyway.
Name: Book 21

text: Sometimes I forget youre still new.
Name: Book 21

text: The Arab Season starts from July and ends in September when the Arabs from the oil rich Gulf States come in their packs and flood Knightsbridge.
Name: Book 21

text: With your selling skills, youll make a killing in commission.
Name: Book 21

text: Big spenders, huh.
Name: Book 21

text: As if she didnt know.
Name: Book 21

text: Big doesnt even begin to describe it, girl.
Name: Book 21

text: The amount of money these people have is obscene.
Name: Book 21

text: All these expensive apartments nearby are empty for the rest of the year until they come and snap them up like cheap hot cakes just to be near the designer stores.
Name: Book 21

text: A few minutes later a different group of Arab women walked past.
Name: Book 21

text: They had multiple bags from the various outlets.
Name: Book 21

text: Lauren from the third floor told me they tend to buy the sexiest outfits, Sam said with a heavy emphasis on the word sexiest.
Name: Book 21

text: Of course they do.
Name: Book 21

text: It amused Zuleka to think that sales assistants were fascinated and gossiped about the Arab ladies across the stores.
Name: Book 21

text: But whats the point.
Name: Book 21

text: I mean nobody gets to see it.
Name: Book 21

text: They do, actually.
Name: Book 21

text: Those women dress up for women, not men.
Name: Book 21

text: What straight man is going to notice whether youre wearing Dior or Gucci from this season or the last, or even care.
Name: Book 21

text: Hes not going to desire you any less, but the women from the same social classes as you will notice, and care enough to point the fact out.
Name: Book 21

text: Its the same for all women; the Arab sisters are no different.
Name: Book 21

text: Hidden from the prying eyes of men at female only parties or weddings, they flaunt, revel, and annoy one another with their latest purchases.
Name: Book 21

text: I guess that makes sense.
Name: Book 21

text: Sam turned her attention elsewhere.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka watched the Arab girls walk out.
Name: Book 21

text: They looked excited and probably were not much older than her.
Name: Book 21

text: She hadnt said so to Sam but, she was willing to bet that when the night fell a few of them would try their purchases on and party the night away in some club.
Name: Book 21

text: Well, if they did good luck to them and I hope they never get caught out.
Name: Book 21

text: She wouldnt wish that on anyone.
Name: Book 21

text: These thoughts brought into her mind the notoriety she knew now wrapped around the very mention of her name because she had been the one who hadnt got away with it.
Name: Book 21

text: By running away she thought she would escape the wagging tongues, but she had made her situation even juicer to the gossip mongers and her reputation had taken a further battering.
Name: Book 21

text: News spread that she refused to get married to her cousin and people cited it as lack of repentance and as evidence that she was trash through and through.
Name: Book 21

text: She knew that over the weeks and months the few minutes captured on film outside the club had grown into a long titillating tale worthy of a Hollywood production in which she starred in many different roles.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani had told her she had heard a variety of versions and with each new telling the facts changed and the description became more and more lurid.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka sighed; she didnt want to become an urban legend with mothers using her as an example to warn their wayward daughters of what could happen if they didnt behave properly.
Name: Book 21

text: Not long ago shed bumped into a woman she knew.
Name: Book 21

text: The woman had spat on the pavement in front of her and before crossing to the other side had said, Huh, you tramp, you thought you would get away with your harem behaviour behind your parents backs.
Name: Book 21

text: But you cant hide anything from Allah; he will always expose and punish those who are doing wrong unto themselves or unto others.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka hadnt been able to take it in.
Name: Book 21

text: The incident had shaken her to her very roots.
Name: Book 21

text: The woman had been a close neighbour who had known her personally.
Name: Book 21

text: How could she be so unforgiving in her judgement.
Name: Book 21

text: But then, all the community had regarded her as the ideal daughter; dutiful, polite and kind, and to them she must seem like the embodiment of the worst kind of sinner -a hypocrite that pretended to be one thing when in fact she was another.
Name: Book 21

text: But if that is so, then in tripping over themselves to condemn her, they forget that hypocrisy is a valid charge only if you have a choice, an option to be something other than what society expects you to be, but with no voice or choice, hypocrisy became the only way for her.
Name: Book 21

text: The feelings provoked by these thoughts kept her spirits down, but she didnt show it to the outside world.
Name: Book 21

text: Sam didnt notice anything, or if she did she hadnt commented.
Name: Book 21

text: The end of the shift had never been more welcome than it was when it finally arrived.
Name: Book 21

text: Every part of her body ached.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani had texted and said they were meeting somewhere for dinner, but she had declined.
Name: Book 21

text: A hot bath and a plate of whatever she could scrape together from the left-overs in the fridge was all she could face.
Name: Book 21

text: Walking up to her place, she was stunned to see the small figure of her mother waiting outside.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka, my daughter Hooyo.
Name: Book 21

text: Zulekas heart pounded against her ribs.
Name: Book 21

text: Her mother stood on the pavement outside the house where she rented a small flat.
Name: Book 21

text: Is everything all right.
Name: Book 21

text: Are you all right.
Name: Book 21

text: How did you find me.
Name: Book 21

text: Her mother cringed from the kisses Zuleka went to bestow on her.
Name: Book 21

text: Never mind all that, and no, nothing is right and I doubt it ever will be again.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka unlocked the front door.
Name: Book 21

text: Do you want to come in.
Name: Book 21

text: I mean, if you took the trouble to track me down, you may as well Of course I do.
Name: Book 21

text: I want to talk to you, daughter.
Name: Book 21

text: I went to the university, but you werent there.
Name: Book 21

text: Others told me you are hardly ever there.
Name: Book 21

text: What are you doing.
Name: Book 21

text: Why are you not keeping up with your studies.
Name: Book 21

text: Hooyo, I have to live.
Name: Book 21

text: What do you expect of me.
Name: Book 21

text: Did you think that I could carry on and exist off fresh air.
Name: Book 21

text: I have a job.
Name: Book 21

text: I work long hours and study at night.
Name: Book 21

text: I go to uni when I can and they let me have materials through the internet, which I access through my laptop, I am behind, but nothing will stop me graduating.
Name: Book 21

text: But how can you.
Name: Book 21

text: You will fail, you are bound to.
Name: Book 21

text: Typical that my education, even now, is taking precedence in her mind over everything else.
Name: Book 21

text: Graduating is something that is taken over the whole of my years at uni, not just one part of it.
Name: Book 21

text: My average grades are so high that I can afford a few lower ones.
Name: Book 21

text: Okay, I wont get a distinction, but I should still attain a first.
Name: Book 21

text: And, I have already secured a junior doctors post in a South London hospital for when I finish uni next year.
Name: Book 21

text: You have nothing to worry about on that score, Hooyo.
Name: Book 21

text: You can still boast about your daughters achievement--that is if you ever speak of me at all.
Name: Book 21

text: Dont you see.
Name: Book 21

text: None of it atones for what you have done.
Name: Book 21

text: Come back home and beg for your fathers forgiveness.
Name: Book 21

text: You have broken his heart, but he still loves you.
Name: Book 21

text: And what about Yemen and Abdul Rahman.
Name: Book 21

text: Are you telling me he wont force me to get married to his nephew.
Name: Book 21

text: Thats the only way to wipe away your shame, Zuleka.
Name: Book 21

text: I am sorry it is such a repulsive idea to you, but you should have thought about that before you took off your clothes and went into discos.
Name: Book 21

text: You have ruined your life.
Name: Book 21

text: Who do you think will want to marry you now.
Name: Book 21

text: I dont care.
Name: Book 21

text: Have you heard what is being said about you out there.
Name: Book 21

text: Do you not care how your actions affect us.
Name: Book 21

text: Are you that selfish that you can only think of yourself and what you want.
Name: Book 21

text: Havent they said enough, hooyo.
Name: Book 21

text: What more can they say.
Name: Book 21

text: How else can they hurt you or me.
Name: Book 21

text: And why must we care what they say.
Name: Book 21

text: Even though it hurt to see her pain she knew there was nothing her mother could say that would persuade her to go back home.
Name: Book 21

text: She had only been living by herself for a short while, but she had tasted freedom and she liked it.
Name: Book 21

text: She came and went as she pleased, she wore what she wanted and the thought of going back to the old ways of living, even if they no longer tried to make her get married, was just not possible.
Name: Book 21

text: She had resolved never to go back, but she tried to make her mother understand even if her father never would, honestly hooyo, I dont care what anybody thinks.
Name: Book 21

text: I want to live on my own.
Name: Book 21

text: I must to do this for me.
Name: Book 21

text: I am a grown woman, but until this happened, I had never spent a week without you or the family telling me what to do or making me account for myself every time I wanted to go out.
Name: Book 21

text: I cant live like that; I need to find myself in order to know who I am.
Name: Book 21

text: Find yourself.
Name: Book 21

text: I didnt know you were lost.
Name: Book 21

text: Do you hear yourself talk.
Name: Book 21

text: My dear child, you may fool yourself into thinking that you are white, but you are not.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka could see her mothers strength seeping out of her body as she looked at the daughter she no longer knew.
Name: Book 21

text: The feeling inside her brought down her own spirit at seeing her mother like this, but she could not give in.
Name: Book 21

text: From somewhere deep within her, her mother found enough voice to deliver a final blow, Your father is right, you are dead to us.
Name: Book 21

text: Should we pass over to the next world before you, dont come to our funeral, or visit our graves.
Name: Book 21

text: Without another word her mother left.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka watched her walk down the street from her window.
Name: Book 21

text: When she could no longer see her she flopped into the nearest chair.
Name: Book 21

text: Her mother, usually a great one for theatrics, always declaring herself to be on the verge of having a heart attack or something equally dramatic, had displayed genuine pain.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka had seen it reflected in her eyes and knew she had meant every single word shed said.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka had long fantasised about living on her own and had always thought when the time came she would be jubilant, ecstatic and over the moon.
Name: Book 21

text: In her imagination she had seen herself screaming from the rooftop, no more curfews or the what, whys, when and wheres, every time she came home late from a night out.
Name: Book 21

text: The restricting culture and customs would be behind her, her destiny no longer written in stone by her family.
Name: Book 21

text: That day had come, she had broken centurys old tradition to be the first woman in her family to live on her own prior to marriage; but instead of feeling proud she felt a severe sadness.
Name: Book 21

text: She had fought a battle, but had a hollow victory.
Name: Book 21

text: Freedom, never bestowed as a benevolent gift, and she wondered what price she would pay.
Name: Book 21

text: Chapter Fourteen The Grime and the Grammies.
Name: Book 21

text: What gives with Zuleka, Hamdi, have you any idea.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani stopped in the process of rubbing sun cream over her exposed stomach.
Name: Book 21

text: She had hired a deck chair, and relaxed back into it, but Hamdi preferred to lie on her towel on the grass.
Name: Book 21

text: Although crowded with fellow sun bathers, they had managed to find a quite spot in Hyde Park that was shrouded in greenery and calmness.
Name: Book 21

text: Shes still smarting from her mothers visit.
Name: Book 21

text: Shell get over it, shes a tough cookie.
Name: Book 21

text: The Arab season should sort her out.
Name: Book 21

text: Nothing short of having more money or a rich boyfriend will do the trick.
Name: Book 21

text: Be patient, girl, and mark my words.
Name: Book 21

text: The time is only a week away to when the streets will seem like they are paved with gold.
Name: Book 21

text: She knew Hamdi had it right.
Name: Book 21

text: Even through her gloom, Zuleka had shown some signs of anticipation.
Name: Book 21

text: Besides, uni had closed for the holidays so that took some of the pressure off her.
Name: Book 21

text: Zuleka only needed her results to come in good so she could go forward into her final year with a chance.
Name: Book 21

text: Things would change for her then.
Name: Book 21

text: Tariq came up to them.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani squinted up at him shading her eyes with her hand.
Name: Book 21

text: A trickle of disappointment at seeing Izzy wasnt with him annoyed her as it wormed into to her gut.
Name: Book 21

text: For God sake, get over it, you idiot.
Name: Book 21

text: She hadnt seen Izzy since the night hed driven her home.
Name: Book 21

text: What had happened had since churned over and over in her mind.
Name: Book 21

text: Shed had to admit his admission had pleased and flattered her, but then, it would have any woman, but on reflection it changed nothing.
Name: Book 21

text: If he could claim to have feelings for someone and yet hit on every girl that came his way, it clearly did not mean much to him.
Name: Book 21

text: And I dont care anyway.
Name: Book 21

text: She had to admit though, him going AWOL made her suspect he was avoiding her and that did rankle.
Name: Book 21

text: Hamdi spent virtually every day at their place and to her discreet probing always said Izzy was just busy in the studio and that she rarely saw him at the house.
Name: Book 21

text: As if reading her thoughts, Hamdi asked Tariq, How is it going in the studio, baby, Oh man, weve been working on some dope materials, replied Tariq as he applied sun cream on Hamdis back, the tracks are almost ready to drop, and then we are off the hook.
Name: Book 21

text: As it turned out, Hani had to admit that Izzy was not wasting his time with the music business.
Name: Book 21

text: Those who knew the UK hip-hop scene, which she did not, thought he had great talent.
Name: Book 21

text: Like Tariq he had started as a DJ for local pirate radio station and so the underground circuits knew him well and his demos and mix tapes proved very popular with the garage and grime crowd.
Name: Book 21

text: She knew he currently worked on another demo tape with Tariq collaborating on the beats.
Name: Book 21

text: All this she had found out once she had decided to listen instead of walk away whenever a conversation led to him and what he did.
Name: Book 21

text: Sounds cool, Hamdi said.
Name: Book 21

text: Yeah, it does, actually.
Name: Book 21

text: Id love to hear some tracks soon.
Name: Book 21

text: Neither Hamdi nor Tariq commented on this change of heart, but without moving her head Hani thought she saw a look pass between them.
Name: Book 21

text: After a few moments of silence, Tariq said, Hey, Hani, Izzys performing one or two tunes at one of the toilet circuits tonight, why dont you come.
Name: Book 21

text: Whats a toilet circuit.
Name: Book 21

text: Tiny, shitty venues.
Name: Book 21

text: Hamdi knows the one, you know, babe, where we were at a couple of weeks ago.
Name: Book 21

text: Yeah, it rocked.
Name: Book 21

text: Let me know if you want to go, Hani.
Name: Book 21

text: Thanks.
Name: Book 21

text: I might check it out.
Name: Book 21

text: Feeling a little embarrassed but not knowing why she should, Hani picked up her book and buried her head in it.
Name: Book 21

text: That titter had nothing to do with her, she was being paranoid.
Name: Book 21

text: Hamdi and Tariq were just having fun together.
Name: Book 21

text: Underground raves or toilet circuits were not her scene but a small part of her wanted to see Izzy again.
Name: Book 21

text: Her position had not changed, but she had decided they should at least be friends.
Name: Book 21

text: Not to mention her curiosity over his music.
Name: Book 21

text: Once inside the dingy east London club Hani regretted the urge that had brought her here.
Name: Book 21

text: It seemed the organisers had squashed a million people into a very small space.
Name: Book 21

text: Theyd had a job to get a taxi to take them this far so arrived after the performances had started.
Name: Book 21

text: This meant they had to stand at the back near to the bar where artificial fog light added to the poor view they already had.
Name: Book 21

text: What happened to fucking Health and Safety laws.
Name: Book 21

text: They must be breaching them, I can hardly breathe.
Name: Book 21

text: Ouch, ouch.
Name: Book 21

text: Chill out, girl, let the music do it for you Fuck, Hamdi, you didnt tell me it would be like this.
Name: Book 21

text: After treading on her toes, the offender now turned and spilled his drink all down her front.
Name: Book 21

text: Resigned to the fact shed get no sympathy from that direction she decided to concentrate on the music.
Name: Book 21

text: Having never listened to Grime, an offshoot of Garage music, before, let alone attend a live performance of it, it took her a while to adjust to the deafening and erratic beats.
Name: Book 21

text: Soon the pure energy and vibe emanating from everyone had her gripped.
Name: Book 21

text: Without realising what happened she found herself at one with the crowd and totally immersed in the fast beats.
Name: Book 21

text: This is different from what I had expected.
Name: Book 21

text: She shouted to Hamdi when Izzy came on stage and continued with the fast, frantic pace.
Name: Book 21

text: If she had thought about it at all, Hani realised, she had expected Izzys music to be like the sugary hip hop tracks that she often heard from Kiss 100FM.
Name: Book 21

text: But the futuristic, electronic beats and dark harsh bass lines totally blew her mind.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani roared as loud as any of the mesmerized crowd as Izzy unleashed his lyrics over the aggressive beats while moving on the stage with a compelling aura of confidence.
Name: Book 21

text: Is this is what they call grime.
Name: Book 21

text: Hanis throat hurt with the throbbing of the beat and having to shout.
Name: Book 21

text: Yeah, I think so.
Name: Book 21

text: Hamdi shouted back Damn, its intense.
Name: Book 21

text: Hot, sweaty and exhilarated, Hani allowed Hamdi to pull her though the crowd.
Name: Book 21

text: Izzy had finished his set and they were all to meet in the small room at the back, used as a kind of dressing-room by the performers.
Name: Book 21

text: She tried to tell herself she found it hard to breathe because of the crowds and the frenzy shed allowed to take her over, but some of it she knew could be down to her worry that Izzy would ignore her or still be angry with her.
Name: Book 21

text: She didnt know anybody who coped well with rejection so knew she should prepare herself for his snub.
Name: Book 21

text: Standing in the middle of the room, Izzy had taken his shirt off and had a white towel draped around his neck.
Name: Book 21

text: His toned stomach glistened with sweat.
Name: Book 21

text: Baby, that was friggin awesome.
Name: Book 21

text: Hamdi leaped into Tariqs arms and congratulated him on the role hed played behind the scenes.
Name: Book 21

text: Well done, that was good.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani kept her gaze on Izzy as she said this.
Name: Book 21

text: Izzy chugged down half a litre of bottled water before pouring the rest on his head to cool himself down.
Name: Book 21

text: Hani tried hard to not look at the water that trickled down his stomach.
Name: Book 21

text: Her mind gave her a comparison to a river rippling over even, beautifully polished cobbled stones.
Name: Book 21

text: Did you enjoy yourself.
Name: Book 21

text: Well, its very different.
Name: Book 21

text: Izzy spent most of his time in the studio recording tracks or writing new material for his debut album.

text: She noticed he changed when he was in his writing mode.

text: The macho bravado went and he became a philosopher, if not quite sensitive, then at least more aware of worldly things than his peers.

text: The more she saw the many different sides to him the more he wriggled into her heart.

text: She found him charming, inquisitive, and spontaneous and knew she sat on a slippery slope, compelling her, despite her efforts to stay aloof and in control, to slide towards falling in love.

text: Though the intensity of her feelings frightened her and felt more like a tumble than a glide.
